article_text:
A frame from footage provided by Ukrainian Military Defense shows an ambush on a column of Russian tanks. (Ukrainian Military Defense)

The Ukrainian military claims to have defeated a regiment of Russian troops and eliminated its commander, Col. A. Zakharov, in Brovary, which is northeast of Kyiv, the Ukrainian Ministry of Defense said on Thursday.

"The commander of the occupier's regiment, Colonel Zakharov, was liquidated. During the battle in the Brovary district of Kyiv region, the battalion tactical group (BTGr) of the 6th tank regiment (Chebarkul) of the 90th tank division of the Central Command suffered significant losses of personnel and equipment," the ministry said on Twitter.

CNN has geolocated and verified the video shared by the defense ministry showing a Russian military column coming under attack and retreating.

The Ukrainian Armed Forces shared videos of the aftermath, which showed a number of destroyed vehicles.

Russian forces are approaching Kyiv from the northeast and east in an effort to complete the encirclement of the capital, but Ukrainian anti-tank weapons have held them off so far.

The Ukrainian army will “nightmare” the enemy, crush him with his own equipment and weapons, we will not leave him alone day or night, the commander-in-chief promised.

The clash in the direction of the city of Brovary near Kiev, which took place a day earlier, ended with the complete defeat of a unit of Russian troops, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Valeriy Zaluzhny said on March 10.

“Our defense forces reliably protect the capital. We will “nightmare” the enemy, crush him with our own equipment and weapons, we will not leave him alone day or night. Everything will be Ukraine!”, – he wrote on his Facebook page and posted a video of a broken Russian technology.





This morning it became known that the Armed Forces of Ukraine made a counterattack near Kiev and knocked out five Russian tanks. The specific location of the event was not reported, but many video footage was released.

Later, the Azov regiment reported that, together with the 72nd brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, during the battle in the Brovarsky district, “almost destroyed the sixth regiment,” including their commander.

The Armed Forces of Ukraine also showed a video of the execution of Russian tanks near Borodianka in the Buchansk region.

Despite losses, Russian troops continue to accumulate military equipment in the Brovarsky district, the Kyiv regional military administration said.



News from Perild.com in Telegram. Subscribe to our channel

The Ukrainian military defeated a tank regiment of Russian troops and eliminated the commander, Colonel A. Zakharov in Brovarsky district, the press service of the Defense Intelligence of the Ministry of Defense said.

"During the conduct of hostilities in the Brovarsky district of Kyiv region, the battalion tactical group of the 6th tank regiment (Chebarkul) of the 90th tank division of the Central Military District suffered significant losses in personnel and equipment. In particular, the commander of the regiment, Colonel A. Zakharov, was liquidated," the press service of the Defense Intelligence of the Ministry of Defense said in a statement.

It is noted that as a result of significant losses of the BTGr of the 6th tank regiment, together with the battalion tactical group of the 239th tank regiment of the 90th tank division, they were forced to retreat and go on the defensive.

In turn, the National Corps press service reported that "Azov" and the 72nd brigade defeated the tank regiment of the Russian Federation, as a result of which the commander of the occupying regiment was liquidated.

The war continues, with further civilians dead at the hands of Russian soldiers. On Wednesday, The EU has agreed to impose sanctions on a further 14 Russian oligarchs, freeze relations with Belarus’ central bank and curb three of the country’s top lenders.

The war in Ukraine and massive sanctions against Russia have triggered a contraction in global trade, sending food and energy prices sharply higher and forcing the International Monetary Fund to lower its global growth forecast next month, IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said.International Monetary Fund chief Kristalina Georgieva said she expected mounting pressure on Russia to end the war in Ukraine given the spillover effects it is having on economies around the world.The Russians have killed more Ukrainian civilians than military from all defense structures, Ukraine's Defense Minister Oleksii Reznikov reported.The US State Department called on the Russian government to allow civilians to safely depart Ukrainian cities and towns besieged by Russian forces, adding the forces now encircle multiple cities after having destroyed much of the critical infrastructure.The Russian defence ministry said it had agreed to allow a Ukrainian repair team to access power lines in the area around the Chernobyl nuclear power station, Interfax news agency said, giving no further details.Another example of Russian soldiers looting stores in Ukraine were screened in the TV.

Russia will suspend exports of wheat, meslin, rye, barley and corn to the Eurasian Economic Union (EEU) until August 31 in a move to secure its home market with enough food, the country's economy ministry announced.Not a single civilian was able to leave the encircled Ukrainian city of Mariupol on Thursday as Russian forces failed to respect a temporary ceasefire to allow evacuations, Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk said on national TV.It is importantthat Ukraine has applied for membership of the EU, but there is no fast-track procedure for accession, Dutch PM Mark Rutte said on Thursday.Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said that Russian President Vladimir Putin had made a choice to "specifically target civilians" and any further targeting of civilians in Ukraine is going to be met with the "severest of responses."After Russian forces began attacking Ukrainian cities such as Mariupol, museums and local authorities rushed to protect their heritage, stowing away precious artworks, religious icons, and fortifying national monuments.
